page.title: 05HOUSING IN LYTHE VILLAGE
page.content: {HOUSING:-} The houses in Lythe village are typical of a North Yorkshire village. {88%}of the houses are built of the local sandstone,many with the characteristic herringbone pattern of the area tooled on to each stone. {10%}of the houses are built of brick or part brick. {2%}of the houses are built of other materials-wood etc.. One of the most interesting facts is that 60% of all houses in the village belong to Mulgrave Estate and of these 26% are occupied under a service tenancy. 25% of the houses are owner occupied and 15% rented from others. 34% are detached,34% semidetached, 28%terraced. Most of the houses have red pantile roofs and sash windows with small panes of glass.
